description: We are a fun energetic company providing tours from Toronto to Niagara Falls. We have safe, reliable vehicles and guides we are certified and licenced by the Nagara Parks Commission

reviews.title: Great tour to Niagara Falls
text: What an utterly amazing trip this was! the falls, well themself are just beautiful. The photos do not tell what it really looks like. It was beautiful. We were in a smaller group which ended up being kind of nice, so we can whip through the sites even faster. The boat is not ready, so we did the falls walking behind. It was nice, but a bit damp. I guess better than the boat!!! The trip is long as there is traffic coming into the city, but the real highlight was the guide. She was the sweetest lady, and really knew her stuff. This overall was a great trip to Niagara Falls, not sure what else we could have done to make it better

reviews.title: Cruise to Montmorency Falls with Get Your Guide is a good way to view them
text: It was raining the day we had booked the cruise to see Montmorency Falls, and it didn't matter to us, because we were indoors on the boat.  Our guide David, totally bi-lingual (of course he was...) smoothly switched back and forth between French and English, but also explained everything in Spanish too, for a family on the boat.  He was knowledgeable, amusing, and told us many detail about the area which other guides had not told us on different tours.  It wasn't a "must do" event but it was definitely enjoyable.

reviews.title: The Maine girls
text: We had John McKinnon as our guide he was very knowledgeable and funny we loved him. The only thing we wished was we had done the tour first before we did a bunch of other stuff. Because everything he talked about I said we did that we did that we did that and the guy that went over the falls twice and lived we saw at Ripley believe it or not.  But we really enjoyed it and I would do again. Thank you.

reviews.title: A must see for people planning to visit Toronto
text: Convenient car, sunny day and moreover the best driver we could have (big up To Roy). This trip will drive you to the most important places. At Niagara Falls sure but also to historical places alongside the river and winery ! Thanks a lot for this experience.

reviews.title: Amazing!
text: You can't visit Toronto and not see the Niagara Falls and so I did.  Much wider and not as high as I expected, but still majorly impressive!

reviews.title: Fun but a little rushed.
text: It was my first time visiting Toronto and I had a great time. The booking says they were offering hotel pick up at select locations. Make sure if you do not know where you are going because you may be new to Toronto to book a hotel from what's listed. Unfortunately I did not and got a little lost meeting up. Make sure you leave a little early just in case. The driver was a little late but understandable due to heavy traffic. What I did not really care for was being rushed from the tour guide when we already started off late when we got to Niagara Falls. There were some parts where the tour guide was helpful and nice but other where he seemed a little frustrated because we were taking too long. He didnt really guide us too much anywhere you spent most of the time exploring by yourself and meeting up somewhere that changed a couple times. I wish there could have been more time to explore Niagara Falls and definitely more time at the wine tour. There wasnt really an actual "wine tour" just some flights of wine that's very sweet like juice with extra sugar. If you like dryer wines I would definitely not recommend this tour because they are showcasing the ice wines which are extremely sweet. I am okay with some sweet wines but these wines are not for drinking the whole bottle but popular in Canada due to the temperature for ice wine. I also would not reccomend buying lunch but finding it on your own. Also do not explore the lower falls it was a waste of money to look at it. There is really nothing to really see. The attractions were really cool I went on the sky wheel which was fun to experience, you get to go around 4 times and see the falls in the air. The rainforest cafe was really cool also and there is an open bar there. I got to experience a couple attractions, ate lunch, and had a cocktail, and took some pictures but there wasnt enough time. I met some nice people while on the tour also.

reviews.title: Niagara Falls Visit on 1/1/2020
text: Cancelled by tour operator. Awaiting refund. Otherwise it would have been amazing experience in winter.

reviews.title: Excellent from start to finish
text: We got picked up by Walter in the designated address and time with a friendly welcome and he was amazing from start to finish - he was so knowledgable and friendly,  for the entire day. There were 7 of us in the party and he catered to everyone’s needs - even down to small details like making sure the seating arrangements were rotated so I wasn’t in the very back of the car we drove in as I’m tall and it didn’t have much leg room!

The whole day was just timed really well and there wasn’t any point where the stop of times felt like they dragged. The day went by very quick and we actually packed in a lot of things such as wine tasting, lunch, Niagara on lake with time to look in all the stores and the Niagara boat tour. I didn’t expect to go on the boat tour and did find this a bit confusing on the information provided - the boat operates into the end of November and only after that is the behind the falls substituted.

My only criticism would be that I emailed in advance to ask to be picked up from our hotel but it wasn’t on the list of hotels they pick up at, so we had a short 10 minute walk to a designated pick up location and then had to go pick up some other guests who stayed in hotels with pick ups available - one of which was literally the hotel next to where we were staying at. I would’ve appreciated being picked up to save time and hassle wandering around a new city.
Despite that minor fact, we had a lovely day and the value for money for a whole day excursion was brilliant, I’d recommend anyone do this.

reviews.title: Good day out
text: Booked with Viator. Directions on where to pick up the tour were pretty straightforward (Strathcona Hotel on York)   About 1hour 40 minutes drive out to niagara   Straight on the boat trip which is absolutely amazing   Then time to explore around Niagara before heading off for 30 minutes wine tasting then finishing up at niagara on the lake for a hour
Our tour guide Michael Francis was very friendly knowledgeable & professional   Would definitely recommend
A very long day   Got back in Toronto around 1900.  But well worth it

reviews.title: Basically a taxi service with a few stops, hardly any added value. Poor communication
text: I booked the tour for 3 people on short notice, for the day after.

To try and arrange meeting details, I sent an email, no response after a few hours, I then tried to call the phone number, only to reach a voicemail every time (5 tries or so on a 2 hours timespan). Eventually got a short email to tell me to meet at a location that was already mentioned in the description. It was rather upsetting to feel that I had paid for something that might not be happening. The communication clearly needs to  be improved.

About the tour itself, it happened to be a 7 people group including us, and therefore the "bus" was actually a 7 people SUV where people at the back were crammed, which was far from comfortable. There was no clear sign to identify it at the meeting point, so I called the number, reaching the voicemail AGAIN. I sent a email, which led someone to call me, that someone talking to the driver at the same time.
It turned out that the driver didn't even have the passenger's number, making the meeting quite an upsetting and difficult one. Poor communication, again...
The driver was a good taxi driver and a nice guy, but not really a tour guide. We didn't learn much.

reviews.title: The Best Tour to Niagara Falls
text: I would commnet these folks for perhaps giving us not on the best tour, but the most professional service. Would love to use them again in the future. Big shout out to Stephen for making our day memorable and for the good laughs.
My wife says it is the Best tour to Niagara Falls!!!

reviews.title: Great tour to Niagara falls
text: We just got back from this trip. we were with another family from Texas. ANDREE was an amazing tour guide!!!!! he was so funny and kept us entertained. I told him he has a true passion for this and its his calling. Some other guests were late, but he took this as an opportunity to get to know the two families a bit more. I thought it was so personable! He was always making sure we were comfortable and wanted feedback on the tour.
So glad we chose to go with this company. Thank you ANDREE for making our families vacation!

reviews.title: Best Tour to Niagara Falls
text: Booked this from the front desk of my hotel. they picked us up quite early 7:15am from Mississauga, but we didnèt mind. We than drove in Canadian traffic to downtown meeting point where we picked up other people for the tour. The guide was nice and gave us a chance to use the wachroom beofre the 1.5 hour drive to the falls. It was cold adn windy but Niagara Falls is a sight to see. Niagara on the lake was nice,m all the shops are outside so it gets cold. The driver let us sit in the bus until everyone else got on.
Great job to the driver for manouvering the bus in the winter storm. Glad we chose this company!

reviews.title: Niagara Falls Tour
text: Very nice tour! Guide Alex (a woman) was fantastic! Very driven and knowledgeable. Boat trip at the falls was quite an experience. The town of Niagara on the Lake is cute and very cozy. The wine tasting with icewine was also well organized. Alex organized another short quiz with questions about everything she told, with prizes, very dedicated guide, compliments to Grayline, this is a very good guide you hired! Also Sam the driver was very friendly. This tour is definitely worth it.

reviews.title: OK but could be much better
text: The actual visit to the Falls was fine, but there was too much time spent in Niagara Falls town, which is pretty awful, and other stuff like Niagara-on-the-Lake and the winery visit, which are OK in themselves, but not relevant if all you want to do is see the Falls.  Also Viator/tripadvisor don't  tell you which company is runnig the trip, so we nearly missed the bus because it said VIP on it and we thought it was going to be something called Niagara Falls Tour or similar. And it takes ages to go round all the hotel pick-ups; is it too much to expect everyone to get to a single central location? On the plus side the guide was good, and the Falls are spectacular.

reviews.title: Great All Day Trip to the Falls
text: This was a great all inclusive round trip from Toronto to Niagra Falls. There was plenty of time to explore on your own during the stops. The extra two stops before the falls were a lot of fun and interesting. The tour guide had a great attitude and lots of fun. The under the falls part was super cool. I would for sure recommend this excursion.

reviews.title: For the price not really worth it
text: The tour guide was a nice guy but the advertisement sounds way better than it actually is. First, there’s no actual wifi on the bus but yes it is temperature controlled. Second, If you’re travelling in April to Niagara Falls I would suggest putting off the tour because you can’t go on the boat cruise and take nice pictures because of the frozen ice on the water.  (That’s the reason why I chose this tour because it was included) You’re probably better off renting a car, driving there and taking your time walking around and enjoying the city of Niagara. It’s a beautiful city with lots of sights, and shops to visit. It’s a better option than having only 1.5 hours to see the Falls and then having to go because you’re on a time restraint to go to other places.

reviews.title: Family Memories Created with Tour to Niagara Falls
text: Just got back from a last minute trip to NiagaraFalls. Tour company was great with handling our tour, as we wanted to surprise my grandpa for his 74th birthday. My grandma doesn't drink,but my grandpa used to work on ships in panama so our guide make a stop at the canal to see how the ships come in and out. He times it just right we got to see a salter going up stream from Lake O to Eerie.
Was possibly the coolest thing ever. My Grandpa loved it.
My grandma got all emoltional and cried when the guide took out family photo at the lock. <3

reviews.title: Best Sightseeing company
text: Nathan was superb. We really enjoyed his knowledge and history of the falls. pick up was done at our AirBnB around 8;00am and returned back at 5;00pm. the stops we made were just enough. the falls booth was under construction so we had to maneuver around a bit. we had free time to get lunch on the hill, we tried the Canadian's favorite "Timmies"
The village was nice, they had a store where my wife picked up some gifts for the grandkids.
We really enjoyed the day and the hospitality by Nathan. Cheers

reviews.title: Fab time on the tour to niagara falls
text: Excellent Hosts of Niagara Falls Tours. We went on a rainy day, but the driver/guide Alex was great. He knows how to keep the rest of the tourist inline. NO coming back late. I can see how this can become an issue, but he did it in such a way that you were looking forward to coming back to the bus to see what the next stop had in store for you. There was not an over amount to see once you did the falls as the rain made it uncomfortable. You can see he does love to tour, he mentioned he has been doing it almost his whole life.
The town was nice, the shops close rather early, we missed the Christmas store. Ironically Cows was open if you wanted ice cream.
Overall we had a nice time and we would visit again with this tour to niagara falls!

reviews.title: Great Host
text: Fun & Exciting Trip. Our Host was Natahan, and he was  a real Gentleman. always made sure we watched our step, and offered umbrellas for the Rain!
The falls look out point was great, as was the village.
Didn't try the wines, but the other couples said it was good. We got back to the hotel early enough to enjoy the night out.

reviews.title: Simply the best tour to Niagara Falls
text: We booked the trip with the boat, but due to the weather the boat was not working. Ther guide took us in the tunnels instead. It was interesting to see, and there is ALOT of water. I have only seen picutres, but we were definately amazed.
The guide offered us extra free time in the village so we could get lunch. We ate at corks, they have great fish and chips for only $20
Pros:
*Friendly driver
As opposed to our uber driver our guide drove an appropiate limit, which made us feel safe
* the day was fairly smooth, there was not too many people on the bus so that helped
*they offer free water
*the bus was quite comfortable and we enjoyed the free wifi
*the guide dropped us off at the Eaten Centre on the way back.

reviews.title: Excellent Trip
text: Tour was good, guide knowledgeable. Niagara on the Lake was a bit small, but nice compared to the big city of Niagara Falls. Didnt care much for the ice wine but it was a nice stop

reviews.title: Great Tour company
text: Tour was great. Really wanted to take the helicopter ride but it was cancelled. Niagara on the lake was smaller than we had imagined.
All in all, good choice for the money

reviews.title: Great
text: My sister and I went on this tour. It was actually amazing.  We needed more time actually at the falls and the area. Will definitely go back and stay a night there.  The clock stop and little chapel in my opinion were not needed. would have liked more time at Niagara lake. But overall great tour.

reviews.title: Excellent Service!
text: Kevin and Lisa are fantastic! They went above and beyond! The bus is climate controlled and comfortable. Kevin did a great and charming job of informing us about highlights on route and at the falls.

reviews.title: Awesome!
text: So first up is the pick-up location... its not specific enough. Its on the square west of the hotel and south of the Tim Hortens.
Then second is the point of not knowing which tour operator to look for... we had 'VIP tours', very comfortable though.
After this.. its only awesome!
Our tour guide was Kevin and he is really great. Giving information with a smile and humor as we go about the surroundings, but also very professional and helpful. Unique in his kind.
So the boat in to the falls, do it! Its awesome and nothing I have ever experienced before. Its like your in one big wasmachine and still having a good time;).

Ten if you booked a lunch its lunchtime, we didn't and got a quick burger to eat at the side of the falls. Trust me there are more then enough places to get (fast)food, for much less money than you'll pay for the pre-booked lunch.
Also if you don't book the lunch, you'll have a hour to yourself and the falls instead  of eating lunch...
Up next is the city of Niagara on the lake. Highly commercial and touristy, didn't like it at all! Got myself a Starbucks and waited...
After a short drive we got to the wine tasting. Tasting.. 2 types of real ICE wine and some information about it. It was nice to drink and fun walking around, but I have had better tastings.
But after all I only went on the tour for the falls and really enjoyed my time! I recommend going, you will never forget it.
Find this review helpful? Let me know and click the like/thumbs-up button below! Thnx:)

reviews.title: Brilliant
text: This was a real up close tour of the Niagara Falls by boat. The falls themselves are amazing, with an awesome weight of water and the boat gets right below the deluge.
It’s all very well organised and professional, with good waterproofing to keep you dry. Excellent.

reviews.title: Tour to Niagara NEVER ANSWERED CALL for pick up!  BOAT LEFT WITHOUT US!!
text: Viator/Trip Advisor took $300.93 from us for the 3 tickets of the falls/winery.  We went to the Sheraton (the pickup point) 1 hour early.  We waited . . . and waited . . . .  We repeatedly phoned the tour company and NO ONE ANSWERED!

We called Viator to ask them questions.  They called the tour company and no one answered.  Viator readily agreed to refund $300.93 given that we were precluded from reaching the touring company to explain where we were, ask how we could try to get to the launch point by driving/walking ourselves, or whether I might take my friends to the winery portion of the tour for them to enjoy that.  Executing the refund, immediately after the Viator asked for my credit card number to issue the credit, the cell lost its connection.

Figuring Viator would stand by what it told me, we stayed in Niagara Falls for the day and simply looked at the Falls.  I then returned home to a message from Viator -- sent over 24-hours after their promise of a refund -- telling me that they would not give me any money back because the tour bus eventually made it to the hotel and five people boarded it.

So although Viator recognized that I was wronged when the touring company did not pick up the phone when I was trying to call them to tell them where we were, to see if I had missed the bus, to find out the first stopping point to catch up (so my friends could enjoy the tour) and no one answered, they backtracked.
I called the touring company and left a message with just my name and phone number.  It's been hours and I've heard nothing.  Even more, Viator has still refused to refund the money.

The end lesson learned is this:  Avoid TripAdvisor/Viator.  Book with the operator directly.  Otherwise, you will be stuck with money-sucking corporate hogs who don't stand by their word.   This post will likely be buried at the end of the review list given that it is unfavorable.  I don't care.  I took the time to make it so you can read it!

reviews.title: Great trip!
text: Our tour guide, Kevin, was amazingly friendly and very genuine! He knew we were waiting for the tour and checked us in so we didn’t even have to search for which bus we needed to get on. The bus was comfortable and the narration was nice. The hornblower boat tour was incredible! We felt a bit rushed to walk around and grab lunch and souvenir shop but other than that, all around a great trip!

reviews.title: Excellent Tour of Niagara Falls
text: We had a wonderful experience on this tour. Once at the Falls things go very quickly and it can be easy to lose the group, but that is only because of the popular tourist attractions. The winery and boat tour were both excellent. Highly recommend. Prepare to be very tired by the end though.

reviews.title: Awesome trip!! Must visit
text: We took the trip with in mid june and i am happy to share that it was amazing! Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable.. we had a great time..

reviews.title: Niagra falls review
text: I honestly thought this tour could not be any better. Grant and Lisa were a great help and couldn’t do anymore for us. Thank you so much for the lovely trip.

reviews.title: Great Value for money
text: Bus was nice and clean. Tour guide was very sweet and made sure that we were well taken care of and comfy. Loved the town on the lake and the wine tasting was quick, but i understand as its a tasting not a wine tour. overall Great value for the price.
